page.title: 02LOWDHAM C.E. PRIMARY SCHOOL.
page.content: Lowdham Primary School is divided into two parts,the old school and the new school.The two buildings are one hundred and fifty metres apart. This causes incovenience because the games field and dining hall are up at the new school and you have to walk up and down for games and dinners. The old school is Victorian and parts of it are falling down.It is divided into five buildings.The largest is occupied by classes 3 and 5. Another holds class 4 and the library.Then there is the school house where they store costumes and jumble and the teachers have their tea.There is a toilet block and the caretakers storeroom. The new school is all one building and houses the two infant classes.
